New Records: England became the first men's team to hold the 20-over and 50-over titles at the same time
Key Match Events: England beat Pakistan by five wickets to claim second T20 world title
Curran takes sublime 3-12, Rashid & Jordan claim two each, Stokes one
Ben Stokes shows trademark calm to hit unbeaten fifty in nervy chase
Pre-Game Insights: Ravi Bopara said 'Franchise cricket has helped England' by improving English players and cricket
Post-Match Reflections: Ben Stokes said 'I am very proud. You don't get to win World Cups too often so to win two of them is pretty special.'
Jos Buttler said 'He is the ultimate competitor in anything he does.'
Sam Curran said 'I am a little bit lost for words. It has been a great tournament for us.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said 'First of all congratulations to England, they deserve to be champions.'
The upsets in the tournament were brilliant and it has kept everybody on their toes.
One of the great things to come from this World Cup is the teams we thought were the lesser teams, we've seen how much they've improved.
Others: The depth of the England team means they can take it deep in these run chases.
The England team are blessed at the moment with the amount of talent they have in this format.
